basics.name: Kisun Pokharel

basics.summary: Bioinformatician applying genomic tools to study different species

work.name: Natural Resources Institute Finland Luke
work.summary: I am working as a Bioinformatician in Statistical Methods group at Luke.

awards.title: Best Poster Award
awards.summary: Best poster prize for my poster titled 'What makes a protein Lysosomal?'

certificates.name: Gut check: Exploring your microbiome
certificates.issuer: MOOC: University of Colorado Boulder and University of California San Diego

publications.name: Whole genome sequencing provides novel insights into the evolutionary history and genetic adaptation of reindeer populations in northern Eurasia
publications.summary: The new genome assembly was generated and utilised to explore genetic diversity, population structure and selective sweeps in Eurasian Rangifer tarandus populations which was based on the largest population genomic dataset for reindeer, encompassing 58 individuals from diverse populations.Two independent reindeer domestication processes were inferred, suggesting separate origins for the domestic Fennoscandian and eastern/northern Russian reindeer.

publications.name: The structure and catalytic cycle of a sodium-pumping pyrophosphatase
publications.summary: The 2.6-angstrom structure of Thermotoga maritima M-PPase in the resting state reveals a previously unknown solution for ion pumping. This was the first membrane protein solved in Finland

references.name: Professor Juha Kantanen
references.reference: Professor Kantanen was the main supervisor of my PhD. I have worked with him for more than 10 years in the field of livestock genomics.

references.name: Professor Adrian Goldman
references.reference: I performed sequence and structure analysis of Thermotoga Maritima membrane bound pyrophosphatase at Professor Goldman's lab.

projects.name: SOMICS
projects.summary: SOMICS - Sheep Omics, Funded by the Academy of Finland. This was my PhD project where I studied fertility traits in Sheep using RNA-Seq.
